original_title: Sri Lanka rupee at 330/333 to dollar in spot next, bond yields down
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka bond yields were down in mid-morning trade and the rupee was quoted at 330/333 to the US dollar in the spot next market, dealers said as an ad hoc peg without a consistent exchange rate policy continued to weaken.
The rupee closed at 328.50/330.00 to the rupee in the spot next market Monday.
Banks were offering to buy dollars from telegraphic transfers at around 324.00 rupees and were selling at 336.00 on their websites.
Sri Lanka rupee has fallen ahead of a bond exchange next months as bank sought to cover open positions.
Sri Lanka’s monetary regime flips from a peg to a float suddenly under the so-called flexible exchange rate used in countries that go to the International Monetary Fund repeatedly.
Sri Lanka’s central bank has also been injecting liquidity through open market operations, after selling down bills outright of late.

Analysts have warned that to get the country out of 73 years of monetary instability, banks and primary dealers have to weaned from liquidity windows to prevent as monetary instability will eventually lead to a loss of confidence in the currency, the country and higher long term interest rates.
Banks are now trying to collect dollars to square their net open positions ahead of a bond exchange.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2030 was quoted at 14.50/60 percent Tuesday down from yesterday’s close of 14.75/85 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.01.2028 was quoted at 14.80/85 percent down from 15.00/15 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 15.20/30 percent closed down from 15.35/40 percent
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 was quoted at 15.30/40 percent down from 15.60/90 percent
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 was quoted at 15.80/16.00 down from 16.00/20. (Colombo/July25/2023)
